basic.floral_language:
Polyscias guilfoylei 
Floriography: tenacious, vital, happy.
The geranium aralia is an evergreen foliage plant. Leaves are oval to round shape, green, occasionally with white patches on leaf surface. It is usually placed in living room, desktop and balcony. The plant could work as an air refresher.
The geranium aralia prefers habitat with mild light, such as bright scatter light. Direct bright sunlight should be avoided. Light green flowers may bloom in March to June if growing well.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in March-June, light green flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, often with white marks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate light, put in places with bright scattered light, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, avoid saturated water
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
